subject: Re: [junit] Junit/Ant/Tinderbox
msgSnippet: On Thu, 09 Aug 2001, jesse mcconnell  ... Apart from CruiseControl, Gump may be interesting, it s a part of the Jakarta Alexandria
messageBody:
On Thu, 09 Aug 2001, jesse mcconnell <jesse_mcconnell@...>
wrote:

> I have a setup of a project using Ant automagically building and
> testing with Mozilla's tinderbox.

Apart from CruiseControl, Gump may be interesting, it's a part of the
Jakarta Alexandria projects, that builds all Java based Apache
projects against the latest versions of each other - to see it in
action: <http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/gump/latest/>

> I am trying to figure out the bext way to get the stacktrace printed
> out in the build log when a failure of error is detected.

Not inside the normal build-log - but each formatter should be able to
do with the stack trace whatever it sees fit. Come to think of it, it
wouldn't be too hard to write a formatter that pushes the stack trace
through Ant's logging system (at least in non-forked mode).

Stefan
